CNN Heroes 2023 Voting Disclosures
Amsterdam’s Latest Effort to Fight Excessive Tourism: No New Hotels
Descriptions: The city wants no more than 20 million hotel stays annually. The measure is one of multiple efforts to control the flow of visitors.

Headlines: How Israel’s Conflicts Could Escalate
Descriptions: Israel’s military is dealing with clashes with Hezbollah in Lebanon and with Iran, as well as the continuing war in Gaza.

Headlines: Qatar Says It Is Reviewing Its Mediator Role as Israel-Hamas Talks Stall
Descriptions: U.S. and Israeli officials have urged the Gulf state to exert more pressure on the Palestinian armed group to reach a deal.

Headlines: Millions of Girls in Africa Will Miss HPV Shots After Merck Production Problem
Descriptions: The company has told countries that it can supply only 18.8 million of the 29.6 million doses it was contracted to deliver this year.

Headlines: After Months of Cocaine Washing Ashore, Australian Police Make an Arrest
Descriptions: Drug parcels kept showing up on beaches along Australia’s shoreline. Now, the police say they found the man behind the botched shipment.

Headlines: W.H.O. Broadens Definition of Airborne Diseases
Descriptions: After a drawn-out global controversy over the coronavirus, the W.H.O. has updated its classification of how pathogens spread through the air.

Headlines: Drought Pushes Millions Into ‘Acute Hunger’ in Southern Africa
Descriptions: The disaster, intensified by El Niño, is devastating communities across several countries, killing crops and livestock and sending food prices soaring.

Headlines: A Japanese Village Wants Tourists to Come for Heat, Soot and Steel
Descriptions: To lure visitors, residents of Yoshida, famed for its high-quality steel, are inviting tourists to help produce it.

Headlines: Thursday Briefing
Descriptions: Europe asks Israel for restraint on Iran.

Headlines: How A.I. Tools Could Change India’s Elections
Descriptions: Avatars are addressing voters by name, in whichever of India’s many languages they speak. Experts see potential for misuse in a country already rife with disinformation.

Headlines: Scotland pauses prescriptions of puberty blockers for transgender minors
Descriptions: The decision came shortly after a report commissioned by England’s state-funded National Health Service concluded that evidence around youth gender care is “remarkably weak.”

Headlines: Prince Harry now officially considers the U.S. — not Britain — his primary residence
Descriptions: The change was revealed in a filing with the U.K.'s Companies House on Wednesday. It comes as Prince William returns to royal duties on Thursday for the first time since Princess Kate's cancer announcement.

Headlines: Trump says 'We're behind Poland' as he meets with President Andrzej Duda
Descriptions: Duda, whose term in office expires in 2025, was one of Trump’s preferred international partners during his 2017-2021 presidency and they have described themselves as friends.

Headlines: Prominent figure in German far-right party stands trial over alleged use of Nazi slogan
Descriptions: The trial comes months before a regional election in which Björn Höcke is running to become his state’s governor.

Headlines: Stabbed Sydney bishop says he forgives attacker
Descriptions: A male teenager has been arrested  and is in the hospital under police guard after the attack, which has been deemed a terrorist act motivated by suspected religious extremism.

Headlines: India kicks off the world's largest elections this week. Here's what you need to know.
Descriptions: Almost a billion voters will decide whether to elect Prime Minister Narendra Modi to a third term, in an election that takes place over six weeks starting Friday.

Headlines: China slams U.S. probe into its shipbuilding industry, calling it a ‘mistake on top of a mistake’
Descriptions: Chinese officials said the U.S. provides hundreds of billions in “discriminatory” subsidies to shipbuilding and other domestic industries, “yet accuses China of adopting so-called ‘non-market practices.’”

Headlines: Russian poetry prize bans entries from transgender people
Descriptions: Under President Vladimir Putin, Russia has engaged in a widespread crackdown on LGBTQ rights, portraying them as a Western invention that threatens traditional Russian values.

Headlines: Video shows woman wheeling a corpse into a Brazil bank to sign for a loan, police say
Descriptions: Bank staffers became suspicious as the man was unable to support his head or hold a pen. They called the police, who arrested the woman and charged her with fraud.

Headlines: Tsunami alert issued after volcano erupts in Indonesia, with thousands told to evacuate
Descriptions: The Ruang volcano has had at least five large eruptions in the last 24 hours.

Headlines: $14.5M gold heist from Toronto airport results in charges for airline employee, 8 others
Descriptions: Peel Regional Police said Wednesday that 6,600 gold bars worth more than 20 million Canadian dollars ($14.5 million) were stolen, the biggest gold theft in Canadian history.
